content: lipbalm mushroom bag-/keychain - pattern by jocupckake mushroom stem for toadstool in white for brown mushroom in beige _ 1 - 6sc in magic_ring - _ 2 - increase x6 12 _ 3 - single_crochet increase x6 18 _ _ 4-5 - single_crochet around 18 2rnds _ 6 - single_crochet decrease x6 12 _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 7-16 - single_crochet around 12 10 rnds - or until your chapstick is covered so far that you can still take it out sew a small white or beige button on the opposite side of the mushroom from where your working yarn is ch30+x slip_stitch in xth st from hook to create a loop for the button adjust x to fit your button hide your yarn end in the chain mushroom cap for toadstool in red for brown mushroom in brown _ 1 - 6sc in magic_ring abbreviations us _ 2 - increase x6 - 12 _ 3 - single_crochet around 12 st - stich _ 4 - single_crochet increase x6 18 round s - round s _ 5 - single_crochet around 18 single_crochet - single_crochet magic_ring - magic_ring _ 6 - single_crochet increase single_crochet x6 24 increase - increase 2sc in 1 st _ 7 - sc3 increase x6 30 decrease - decrease single_crochet 2 together _ 8 - sc2 increase sc2 x6 36 chain - chain _ 9 - sc5 increase x6 42 slip_stitch - slipstitch _ 10 - crab st around 42 crab st - crab stitch aka reverse single_crochet fo and weave in ends half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet mushroom spots - for toadstool leave out for brown mushroom in white small - sc4 in magic_ring slip_stitch in 1st single_crochet fo medium - sc6 in magic_ring slip_stitch in 1st single_crochet fo large - hdc6 in magic_ring slip_stitch in 1st half_double_crochet fo make 2 of each size and sew onto the cap assembly thread the chain through the cap between rounds 4&5 going up through from the bottom and then back down through from the top on the opposite side put the loop around the button and you re done unthreading the last pull-through you can thread the chain around the handle of a tote bag for example havegun
